abstract: World's first large-scale carbon capture electrical plant project, known as SaskPower's Boundary Dam 3, has experience number of shutdowns and has fallen far short of carbon emissions targets; coal facility, located in Saskatchewan, Canada, also faces unsolved problem with its core technology; $1.1 billion effort was initially thought to be unqualified success; advocates say problems at plant are typical of any emerging, complex technology.

headline.print_headline: Project for Cleaner Coal Energy Falters
headline.main: Technology to Make Clean Energy From Coal Is Stumbling in Practice

snippet: A large-scale project in Canada to capture carbon from a coal-burning power plant has fallen short of its goal and its costs are soaring.
lead_paragraph: A large-scale project in Canada to capture carbon from a coal-burning power plant has fallen short of its goal and its costs are soaring.
